intro: Alsine austriaca f. grignensis, commonly known as the Grignan alsine, is a variant of the Austrian alsine, a flowering plant in the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its small, pink to purple flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant is typically found in moist, calcareous soils in mountainous regions of Europe. It is a low-growing perennial that often forms dense mats. Its botanical significance lies in its ecological role and its use in traditional herbal medicine.
